name: Kyndryl
title: Practice-Based AI Model with Alliance-Driven Agent Development and IBM Heritage

classification.classificationRationale: M2 classification confirmed and upgraded from Low to Medium confidence after enrichment. The Applications, Data and AI practice under Michael Bradshaw functions as the structural home for AI capability: it sets standards, builds the AgenTeq Framework, provides guardrails, and enables both internal and customer-facing AI work. The SAP Center of Excellence, AI Innovation Labs (Liverpool, Singapore), and cross-functional governance committee that evaluates/approves AI use cases are all classic CoE indicators — governance, standards, enablement. While Kyndryl has 5 co-equal Global Practices, the AI practice is the recognized center for AI methodology and capability. Decision tree: formal AI unit? YES (Applications, Data and AI practice). Central team builds or enables? ENABLES primarily (standards, frameworks, governance for customer AI transformation). Structural orientation: the AI practice is structurally separate from the other 4 practices with a dedicated leader (Bradshaw) and mandate.

description:
Kyndryl, the IT infrastructure services company spun off from IBM in 2021, organizes AI work through a practice-based model rather than a centralized AI unit. Five Global Practices form the organizational backbone: Applications, Data and AI (Michael Bradshaw), Cloud (Nicolas Sekkaki), Core Enterprise and zCloud (Hassan Zamat), Cyber Security and Resiliency, Network and Edge (Paul Savill), and Digital Workplace (Ivan Dopple). The Applications, Data and AI practice — created through a July 2024 leadership reshuffle that moved Bradshaw from CIO to practice leader (swapping roles with Sekkaki) — functions as the Center of Excellence for AI capability, setting standards, building the AgenTeq agentic AI framework, and providing methodology across customer engagements.

Kyndryl Bridge is the AI-powered IT management platform serving 1,200+ customers with 190 services, functioning as the operational backbone rather than a separate AI team. A cross-functional governance committee evaluates and approves AI use cases for regulatory and risk alignment. AI Innovation Labs in Liverpool and Singapore provide prototyping capability. Kyndryl Consult (SVP Ismail Amla) delivers agentic AI organizational change management services. The alliance-driven agent development model is distinctive: 100 AI agents built in 100 days with Google Cloud, plus deep partnerships with Microsoft (16,000+ employees with 26,000+ certifications), NVIDIA, SAP, and AWS.

The company is financially profitable but under significant pressure. Revenue is declining in constant currency, the stock plunged ~25% after Q3 FY2026 results missed estimates (February 2026), and interim appointments for CFO and General Counsel signal leadership instability. Headcount has declined from ~90,000 at the 2021 IBM spinoff to ~60,000. However, AI is the growth story: 25% of new contracts include AI-related services, hyperscaler revenue hit $500M/quarter (+58% YoY), and the Consult practice grew 24%. CEO Martin Schroeter (former IBM CFO) frames Kyndryl as the bridge between line-of-business AI ambitions and CIO/CTO operational realities — positioning the company at the infrastructure layer of enterprise AI adoption.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: 5 Global Practice Leaders (Bradshaw, Sekkaki, Zamat, Savill, Dopple) → Group President Elly Keinan or CEO Schroeter. CTO Antoine Shagoury (Bridge platform). CIO Kim Basile (internal IT, replaced Bradshaw July 2024). Chief Transformation Officer Nel Akoth. SVP Global Strategic Alliances Giovanni Carraro (partner-facing AI). SVP Kyndryl Consult Ismail Amla (consulting delivery).
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: ~60,000 employees (down from 90,000 at spinoff). Revenue $15.1B FY2025. Q3 FY2026: revenue $3.9B, hyperscaler $500M (+58% YoY). AI Innovation Labs in Liverpool and Singapore. 30,000+ employees with partner certifications. 16,000+ employees with Microsoft certifications. Kyndryl Bridge: 1,200+ customers, 190 services.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: 12-24 month customer engagement cycles. The '3 As' strategy (Advanced Delivery, Alliances, Focus Accounts) on multi-year transformation. Hyperscaler revenue growing on quarterly cadence. Company transitioning from declining managed infrastructure to higher-margin consulting/AI.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Bradshaw leads AI practice and methodology. CTO Shagoury leads Bridge platform. Carraro leads alliance-driven AI agent development. Cross-functional governance committee approves AI use cases. CEO Schroeter sets strategic narrative.
observableMarkers.metrics: 25% of new contracts include AI. Hyperscaler revenue $500M/quarter (+58% YoY). Consult +24%. 100 agents built in 100 days (Google Cloud). 1,200+ Bridge customers. Stock -25% after Q3 FY2026 miss. FY2026 guidance lowered.

layers.label: SAP Transformations Center of Excellence Launch
layers.summary: Kyndryl launched SAP Transformations Center of Excellence on Jan 27, 2026. Dedicated hub with 500+ professionals combining SAP expertise with Kyndryl Agentic AI Framework. Also partnering with Dow on AI/automation implementation under Dow's Transform to Outperform program. The CoE model (500+ dedicated professionals) gives concrete scale to Kyndryl's AI structural approach.

layers.label: Full practice-based AI structure with 9 key leaders and alliance model
layers.summary: Enrichment reveals practice-based AI model: 5 Global Practices with dedicated Applications, Data and AI practice under Bradshaw (moved from CIO July 2024). Cross-functional governance committee for AI use case approval. Kyndryl Bridge platform (1,200+ customers, 190 services). AI Innovation Labs in Liverpool and Singapore. Alliance-driven agent development (100 agents in 100 days with Google Cloud). Kyndryl Consult delivers agentic AI organizational change management. Financials under pressure: stock -25% after Q3 miss, interim CFO/GC, headcount ~60K (from 90K at spinoff). Growth in AI: 25% of contracts include AI, hyperscaler +58% YoY. M2/Structural confirmed at Medium confidence.

layers.label: SAP Center of Excellence Established
layers.summary: Kyndryl established a SAP Center of Excellence — a dedicated hub where customers co-create with designers and engineers to unlock AI potential for SAP transformations. Partnership with Nova Intellig mentioned.
layers.classification: M2 Center of Excellence (original — limited data)

openQuestions: How much of Kyndryl's AI work is internal transformation vs. customer-facing delivery — and does the taxonomy need to distinguish these?
What is the cross-functional governance committee's actual composition and how frequently does it meet?
How has the Bradshaw CIO→AI practice swap affected internal AI capability — did bringing operational CIO experience to the AI practice change how they deliver?
What is the financial trajectory for AI-inclusive contracts — will the 25% grow fast enough to offset declining legacy infrastructure revenue?
How does the IBM spinoff heritage (mainframe expertise, large enterprise relationships) shape the specific AI use cases Kyndryl pursues vs. born-in-cloud competitors?
taxonomyFeedback: [2026-02] Kyndryl is primarily a services company — their AI structure is about enabling CLIENT AI transformations, not their own. This raises an important taxonomy question: should IT services firms be classified by their internal AI structure or their client delivery model? The collection may need a 'services firm' habitat tag to distinguish these.

[2026-02] The July 2024 Bradshaw/Sekkaki swap (CIO→AI practice leader, AI practice leader→Cloud) is a telling structural signal: Schroeter wanted operational CIO experience applied to AI commercialization. This is a deliberate capability-matching move, not just a reshuffle.

[2026-02] The alliance-driven agent development model (100 agents in 100 days with Google Cloud, partnerships with Microsoft/NVIDIA/SAP) is structurally distinctive — Kyndryl builds AI capabilities through partnerships rather than internal R&D. This is neither M1 (research) nor M3 (embedded) but a partner-mediated CoE model.

[2026-02] The simultaneous financial pressure (stock -25%, guidance cut, interim CFO) and AI growth story (hyperscaler +58%, 25% of contracts) creates a classic ambidexterity tension: the legacy business is shrinking while the AI business is growing. Whether the company can survive the transition depends on the speed of the crossover.

[2026-02] IBM heritage is visible in the practice-based organizational structure, mainframe expertise (Agentic AI Framework for Mainframe launched Feb 2026), and large enterprise customer base. The IBM connection is both asset (relationships, domain knowledge) and liability (association with legacy infrastructure).
